popupAnnouncement.ctaText: Discover MetaMask Portfolio today. Track and manage your web3 assets in one place!

seo.pageTitle: Customize your wallet with MetaMask Snaps
seo.pageDescription: Discover, install, and use community-built features in your MetaMask wallet today.

node.headline: Customize your wallet with MetaMask Snaps

childMarkdownRemark.html: Discover, install, and use community-built features in your MetaMask wallet today.
With features that you can install to customize your wallet, MetaMask Snaps is the next leap forward toward a future that is infinitely scalable.
Connect to non-Ethereum blockchains with MetaMask
Stay informed with insights before you confirm transactions in MetaMask
Stay in the know with web3 notifications and chat directly in MetaMask
Add new Ethereum account solutions backed by enhanced security measures
How do we make web3 more accessible to the masses? Erik Marks paints the picture

modules.title: Snaps in MetaMask Stable and Where We Go From Here

childMarkdownRemark.html: Learn about the Snaps story from MetaMask co-founder Dan Finlay

modules.title: Decentralizing the wallet experience with Snaps

childMarkdownRemark.html: Learn more about how MetaMask Snaps helps pioneer a permissionless future from Christian Montoya

MetaMask Snaps allows users to add features and functionality to their MetaMask wallet. Individual snaps are features created by third-party developers that MetaMask users can install directly into their wallet.

We believe a decentralized internet that is accessible to all and owned by the people who use it, will give rise to human flourishing on an exponential scale. Whilst our roots are in Ethereum, and our expertise is grounded in building the leading self-custodial wallet, we appreciate that innovation occurs in many domains across the web3 ecosystem. With Snaps, we hope to capture the full extent of the innovation happening in web3, by enabling developers to bring their specialist expertise to building for our platform.

A Snap is an application that adds features and functionality to MetaMask. Snaps can connect to blockchain protocols beyond Ethereum, show insights about transactions, display notifications, add new privacy and identity features, and much more.

Snaps run in a sandboxed environment and use a permissions model to protect your data and respect your consent. Snaps do not have access to your MetaMask accounts or other internal data. When installing a Snap, make sure you understand what permissions you are granting to stay secure. You can find and install Snaps from our directory. Need help? Reach out to our official support team.

modules.question: How do I uninstall or disable a Snap?

childMarkdownRemark.html: Looking to (temporarily) disable a Snap? You can easily do so by accessing the Snap’s settings. No longer need a specific Snap? Read our guide about uninstalling a Snap.

Are you a developer?
  • Learn how to build a Snap
  • Share your Snap here

Snaps created by third-party developers are a Third Party Service as defined in the Consensys Terms of Use. You access, rely upon or use the Third Party Service at your own risk. Consensys disclaims all responsibility and liability for any losses on account of your use of Third Party Services. Always do your own research before installing any Snap, and carefully review the permissions requested. By including a Snap on the allowlist, Consensys is not endorsing, recommending, or guaranteeing the safety of this Snap for your use or use for any reason.

The MetaMask Snaps Open Beta is a first look at what's possible when extending the capabilities of your wallet. We invite those who are comfortable trying new features to test out these Snaps built by talented community developers.

embed.embed: <iframe width="992" height="558" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/mneNl4Dr8sM?&rel=0&sub_confirmation=1" title="Introducing MetaMask Snaps" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Security comes first

Snaps run in a sandboxed environment and use a permissions model to protect your data and respect your consent. Snaps don’t have access to your MetaMask account data. When installing a Snap, you can always verify the permissions you are granting.
Need help? Reach out to our official support team.

Snaps currently featured in the MetaMask Snaps Directory have been audited by our team and third parties. Over time, we plan to open up the auditing process to create a fully permissionless platform.

Open Beta available today

Explore MetaMask Snaps alongside 100M+ users directly in MetaMask Extension
We can’t build an open world on our own. Learn more and contribute to our decentralized, long-term vision of MetaMask
We're sparking a movement that embraces decentralized innovation. Come shape this permissionless world with us.
